p:
Eight South American plant extracts were assessed for antiviral activity against HSV-1 strains KOS and 29-R/acyclovir-resistant by Muller et al.
108 Extracts were prepared with water, ethanol, 40% hydroethanol, or methanol. Antiherpetic activity, defined by the authors as a SI >7, was exhibited toward HSV-1 strain KOS by the aqueous extract of Ilex paraguariensis (EC 50 = 80.0 μg/ml and SI = 15.8) and the methanolic extracts of Rubus imperialis (EC 50 = 70.0 μg/ml and SI = 19.8) and Lafoensia pacari (EC 50 = 60.0 μg/ml and SI = 19.0). Additionally, antiherpetic activity against strain 29-R/acyclovir-resistant was observed by the aqueous extracts of I. paraguariensis (EC 50 = 100.0 μg/ml and SI = 12.6) and Passiflora edulis (EC 50 = 89.9 μg/ml and SI = 17.8) and the methanolic extracts of R. imperialis (EC 50 = 90.0 μg/ml and SI = 15.4) and Sloanea guianensis (EC 50 = 140.0 μg/ml and SI = 10.0).
